verses.roman:
apartv aty-ulbaṇaṁ varṣam
ati-vātaṁ śilā-mayam
sva-yāge vihate 'smābhir
indro nāśāya varṣati

synonyms: apa-ṛtu—out of season; ati-ulbaṇam—unusually fierce; varṣam—rain; ati-vātam—accompanied by great wind; śilā-mayam—full of hailstones; sva-yage—his sacrifice; vihate—having been stopped; asmābhiḥ—by Ourselves; indraḥ—King Indra; nāśāya—for destruction; varṣati—is raining.
translation: [Śrī Kṛṣṇa said to Himself:] Because We have stopped his sacrifice, Indra has caused this unusually fierce, unseasonable rain, together with terrible winds and hail.
